founders.name: Tyler Denk
founders.bio_summary: Former growth/product lead at Morning Brew; co-founded beehiiv in Oct 2021 to build a newsletter stack focused on owned audience growth.

founders.name: Benjamin Hargett
founders.bio_summary: Co-founded beehiiv after working with Denk on Morning Brew’s newsletter operations.

founders.name: Jake Hurd
founders.bio_summary: Co-founder who also came from Morning Brew’s newsletter team, building the initial platform with Denk and Hargett.

product_summary: Platform to create, publish, and monetize newsletters with referral programs, boosts, ad network, web builder, and analytics built for growth.
pricing: Launch $0 (up to 2,500 subscribers); Scale $43/mo or $517 billed annually (up to 100,000 subscribers); Max $96/mo or $1,151 billed annually (up to 100,000 subscribers); unlimited email sends on all tiers.

core_problem.statement: Founders who built Morning Brew’s newsletter stack saw that existing tools lacked growth and monetization features for owned audiences; they built beehiiv because email remained the most lucrative and controllable channel versus social platforms.

kpi.value: $4M run rate / $3M ARR; profitable on monthly basis April 2023

competition.name: Substack
competition.reason_compared: Direct newsletter publishing and monetization platform competing for writers and paid subscriptions.

competition.name: ConvertKit
competition.reason_compared: Email marketing tool used by creators for newsletters and automations.

competition.name: Mailchimp
competition.reason_compared: Established email service provider for marketing newsletters and automation.

user_validation.detail: Boston Globe Media and Brex use beehiiv; individual creators include Arnold Schwarzenegger’s newsletter.

market_background.insight: Global email users are approaching 5 billion, indicating newsletters remain a sticky owned channel for distribution and monetization.

sources.note: Series B coverage with 20k active newsletters, 1B monthly emails, customer revenue, and customer examples.
Series A article detailing founding in Oct 2021, founders, 7,500 active newsletters, 35M readers, 350M impressions, revenue run rate, and Morning Brew background.
Official pricing page showing Launch $0 (2,500 subs), Scale $43/mo ($517 annual), Max $96/mo ($1,151 annual) with subscriber caps.
Statista projection that global email users are nearing 5 billion, used for market context.

feasibility.reason: Founder story is documented (ex-Morning Brew) with clear pain around owned growth, strong usage metrics (20k newsletters, 1B monthly emails), and a large addressable email market nearing 5B users.
